column4: jordan_u: ok. ill do it now. but the thing in my head is win xp 64bit uses ntfs and linux is different after the partition, setup, and grub optimizing is there a chance of a crush somehow?
or is ubuntu cant handle 4gb ram usage with 32 bit?
jordaj_u: ok. ill do it now. but the thing in my head is win xp 64bit uses ntfs and linux is different after the partition, setup, and grub optimizing is there a chance of a crush somehow?
win xp 64bit uses ntfs and linux is different after the partition, setup, and grub optimizing is there a chance of a crush somehow in future?
and is it possible running XP setup on ubuntu througgh the parted drive?
is it possible running XP setup on ubuntu inside through the parted drive?
gaaah im gonna kamikaze : ) need help masters please
you could see the VBox instructions for working with physical partitions at http://www.virtualbox.org/manual/ch09.html#rawdisk BUT notice the big warning in red (also I've never tried this!)

vw what's that?  "just want to split my h.d." well the installer default to installing "side by side" which is a separate partition for windows and linux.  don't understand your WinXP question at all i'm affraid.
typing zykoticK9 is a pain - using <Z><y><TAB> is SO much easier.

my cd drive is broken, have no usb stick and thats why i cannot boot from win xp disk to install xp. what i am asking is can i install xp by double clicking while the ubuntu is running. im sorry for my blurry explanation, also thx for the advice
sorry that is a windows issue for sure, you could try ##windows - i have NO idea how you could launch Windows Installer from inside Linux - i highly doubt wine will work.
upon thinking about it - wine will not work for a physical install.  Good luck man.
lovely : ) dont treat me like this just started to adore linux  after 7 years
not a linux issue.  good luck.
